page.title: 04Clerkenwell&Finsbury05310182
page.content: Clerkenwell and Finsbury lie almost immediately northwards of the City of London. Practically bordered by one of the Thames's main tributaries, the Fleet River, the area has also always been famous for an abundance of good quality fresh water.This is reflected in place names, as Clerkenwell itself, and that many industries are 'water based'.The locality is now mainly residential, providing workers for the City and central London. The two main Post Office HQ, and the Smithfield meat market have also been traditional important employers. Most housing is modern or modernised. A ready market for labour has thus always meant waves of immigration.From other parts of the UK, central & southern Europe, the Mediterranean, the Carribbean and all over Asia, they have come to live and give their character to the district.
